data.info:
1. Information

Typhoid fever is a life-threatening disease caused by Salmonella Typhi virus.
Spread through: Gastrointestinal tract due to ingestion and ingestion of contaminated food or by direct contact with the patient.
Symptoms: sudden onset with high fever, high fever, headache, fatigue, anorexia, rhythm, constipation or diarrhea and dry cough. However, there are also mild or asymptomatic cases. The incubation period depends on the amount of bacteria entering the body, an average of 8 to 14 days.
Complications of the disease: arthritis, edema leading to necrosis, ulcers in the digestive system. The ulcer may be deep in the muscle, serosa and intestinal perforation.
Typhoid fever can be prevented and can usually be treated with antibiotics.

2. Preventive measures

Vaccinate only one vaccine and repeat every 3 years.
Recommended for 2 year olds and adults.
